pros:
My co-workers are fantastic, and my managers do try to fight for me
The patients are great and love coming in
cons: Busy all the time with patients

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Sonoma, CA
pros: Small hospital, friendly staff. Family like feeling.
cons: Census can be really low, canceled shifts occur.
nothing to say at this time

review_title: One of Sonoma County's larger employers
pros: Community-based, personal, caring service; pretty good benefits.  Mostly fun, professional team players are employed, the rest are weeded out.
cons: Some obvious favoritism here, some "special" people get to work from home from across the country. Others have their whole families employed at crazy salaries

pros: Wonderful environment, caring employees, beautiful location, progressive management.  It truly is a great place to work.  The staff cares about each other.  Management encourages growth and development.
cons: Usual politics. If you are new it seems like everyone knows each other.   It takes time to make changes but even the doctors seem to be coming around to the 21st century.

job_title: Medical Imaging Clerk in Sonoma, CA
pros: Worked in Medical Imaging--terrific staff and very supportive to both their co-workers and to the patients.  Everyone really worked together to provide optimal service.
cons: Due to the smallness of the dept, sometimes hard to get a day off.

review_title: The employees are supportive of one another. The work environment is positive.
pros: The people are kind and supportive of one another. The work environment is positive. Everyone is proud of their work and cares for their patients.
cons: Smaller hospital, people get called off if/when census is low.

job_title: Clerk to Board of Directors in Walnut Creek, CA
pros: Community, colleagues, comradery, benefits, salaries, and tremendous quality of life in the City of Sonoma.
cons: There’s are challenges (financial)  that all hospitals face but particularly small, independent hospitals like Sonoma Valley.  But the future remains positive.

review_title: Bumpy road of progress but now with a better ER and OR facility
pros: Work/life balance; great colleagues, pretty commute
cons: Not as transparent as claiming to be

pros: dedicated employees who believe in the work they are doing for the community
cons: politically charged.  public thinks they run the hospital and took great liberties with that.

job_title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist in Sonoma, CA
pros: Sonoma is a pleasant community Hospital
cons: Discontinued using quality, safe CRNA.  This was a poor decision for the hospital and community.

pros:
Friendly staff and wonderful patients!
Healthy food in the cafeteria
Yearly/bi-yearly raises
Super flexible schedule
cons: None. I guess we just need more bilingual staff to help the communication between patients and doctors/nurses

review_title: Tele Tech., Unit Sec., Nursing Assistant
pros: Friendly Staff, Great Management, Busy Floor
cons: No real Telemetry monitoring, a lot of job duties for little pay

job_title: Nursing Administrator Coordinator in Sonoma, CA
pros: Management actively support mission and values,conduct business in an ethical manner and provide career opportunities
